results.title: In a lonely place
results.creator_credit: Santana, Robert Lord and Nicholas Ray
results.brief_description: Dixon Steele (Humphrey Bogart), a neurotic and deeply disturbed screenwriter on the down-hill slide is accused of murdering the hatcheck girl of his favourite hang-out. To his surprise, he is supplied with an alibi by his next door neighbour, Laurel Gray (Gloria Grahame). Brub Nicholai (Frank Lovejoy), the investigating officer and a former war buddy of Dix, remains unconvinced and exerts pressure on his friend in order to make him crack. Meanwhile, Dixon and Laurel embark on a romance, but the extreme pressure Dixon must endure both from the police and the studios, soon brings out his violent temper. As the romance disintegrates, so too does Dixon’s mental state. During filming Gloria Grahame’s relationship with director Nicholas Ray ended, and many saw in Bogart’s character a reflection of Ray’s own personal turmoils. Bogart himself drew away from the immaculate persona so often used in his previous films to create a flawed and hounded human being. Critical of Hollywood mores (although it was scripted by Andrew Solt, a recent emigre screenwriter who was absolutely charmed by it), the film bears none of the strange fascination for the studio setting contained in an other Hollywood insiders film made the same year: ‘Sunset Boulevard’. Adapted from the novel ‘In a Lonely Place’ by Dorothy B. Hughes. Reference: Bernard Eisenschitz. ‘Nicholas Ray: an American Journey’ Faber and Faber, 1990.

results.title: Immortal beloved [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: ICON, Bruce Davey and Bernard Rose
results.brief_description: When a cryptic letter from musical genius, Beethoven, turned up shortly after his death, it started one of history’s most compelling romantic mysteries. An enduring riddle that remains unsolved to this day. Who, among the scores of women that Beethoven seduced, was his “Immortal Beloved”? Gary Oldman and Isabella Rossellini share a love as hypnotic as the music Beethoven created, in this enthralling film based on the celebrated life of one of the greatest composers that ever lived.

results.title: Images
results.creator_credit: Hemdale Film Corporation, Lions Gate Films, Tommy Thompson and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Neglected by her husband, an emotionally disturbed woman locks herself away in a world of fantasy. Unable to completely escape reality, her brave attempts to maintain composure ultimately crash with frightening violence. A tense and thrilling drama. Stars Susannah York, Rene Auberjonois, Marcel Bozzuffi, Hugh Millais, Cathryn Harrison.

results.title: Illegally yours
results.creator_credit: Crescent Moon, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: This is the off-beat story of Richard Dice (Rob Lowe), a college dropout who comes back home only to find himself on jury duty in the trial of his high school-sweetheart, Molly (Colleen Camp), who is charged with murder. Convinced she’s been framed, he sets out to prove her innocence - only things don’t go according to plan when he finds himself the target of a band of crazy thugs; shady conspirators; millionaires; jurors; judges and the police. But really, what’s a little perjury, blackmail, burglary and murder among friends.

results.title: Ikiru = to live = living = doomed
results.creator_credit: Tokyo Film, Shojiro Motoki and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: ‘Ikiru’ is a departure from Kurosawa’s other work and presents a thoughtful and moving piece on life and death. The film opens with an x-ray detailing the stomach cancer of the main character, Kanji Watanabe. The image sets the premise of the piece but not necessarily the tone, which vacillates between hope and despair. Kanji’s physical and mental health is not only damaged by the cancer within, but as Kurosawa subtly suggests, is also contributed to by the inertia of Kanji’s civil service job and life in post-war Tokyo. The film is primarily concerned with Kanji’s struggle to accept his condition and the downwards spiral that drives him to self destructive behaviour. He eventually meets a girl who convinces him that he should spend his dying months doing good. This prompts him to seek approval for having a children’s playground built. The playground will provide a source of enjoyment to the children of the community as well as be an epitaph to good citizen Kanji. Cast includes Takashi Shimura, Nobuo Kaneko, Kyoko Seki and Miki Odagiri. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Idiot box
results.creator_credit: Central Park Films, Glenys Rowe and David Caesar
results.brief_description: Looking for the fast track out of suburban hell, two natural born losers scheme an impossible bank heist. They feel they have strong credentials, as they spend their days watching crime dramas on television and it’s about time they put what they’ve learnt into practive. Kev, angry, unemployed, and an accident waiting to happen gets the guns. Mick, slack, cynical and also unemployed, masterminds the plan. Cast includes Ben Mendelsohn, Jeremy Sims, Robyn Loau and John Polson.

results.title: Identification of a woman = Identificazione di una donna
results.creator_credit: IterFilm, Gaumont-British Instructional, Lynn Kamern and Michelangelo Antonioni
results.brief_description: Niccolo (Thomas Milan) needs a female for his next film project, but his ideas for both project and protagonist are somewhat vague. As his relationship with his girlfriend dissolves - she leaves him to move in with another woman, - he embarks on an affair with a young actress, but she, too, eventually eludes him. Perhaps Antonioni’s most beautiful film, this is not only the story of Niccolo’s search for his ideal woman, it is the search for his own identity which drives this film to its poignant conclusion. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Iceman
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Patrick Palmer, Norman Jewison and Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: Drama about a team of Arctic researchers who find a 40,000 year old man frozen in ice and bring him back to life. The anthropologist wants to befriend him and learn about man’s past while the medical researchers want to discover the secret that will allow man to live in a frozen state. Stars Timothy Hutton, John Lone and Lindsay Crouse.

results.title: I Was a male war bride
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Sol Siegal and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Classic Howard Hawks’ comedy sees Cary Grant play Captain Henri Rochard, a French officer who falls for an American army official staioned in Europe. Following the chaos however, and bureaucratic red-tape that marked the cessations of hostilities in World War 2, the pair find it almost impossible to make their union legal. Circumstances force Rochard to pose an a ‘war bride’ in order to secure happiness, which of course leads to no end of strife and embarrassment for the eager groom.
